remarks: The exponential function maps the set ` S ` , of complex numbers with imaginary part in a real interval of length ` 2 x. _pi ` , one-to-one onto the nonzero complex numbers.  (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 16-Apr-2008.)  (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 13-May-2014.)
statement:
eff1olem.1 $e |- F = ( w e. D |-> ( exp ` ( _i x. w ) ) ) $.
eff1olem.2 $e |- S = ( `' Im " D ) $.
eff1olem.3 $e |- ( ph -> D C_ RR ) $.
eff1olem.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. D /\ y e. D ) ) -> ( abs ` ( x - y ) ) < ( 2 x. _pi ) ) $.
eff1olem.5 $e |- ( ( ph /\ z e. RR ) -> E. y e. D ( ( z - y ) / ( 2 x. _pi ) ) e. ZZ ) $.
eff1olem $p |- ( ph -> ( exp |` S ) : S -1-1-onto-> ( CC \ { 0 } ) ) $.
